snippet: A senior commander was dismissed for initiating peace talks with the Pakistani government, provoking anger in the militants’ ranks.
abstract: Abrupt dismissal of Pakistani Taliban commander Maulvi Faqir Muhammad, for initiating peace talks with the Pakistani government, raises the prospect of a damaging leadership rift in the militants' ranks; dismissal offers the Islamabad government a fresh opportunity to weaken a foe that has killed thousands of Pakistanis.

byline.contributor: Ismail Khan contributed reporting from Peshawar and Ihsanullah Tipu Mehsud from North Waziristan.

lead_paragraph: A senior commander was dismissed for initiating peace talks with the Pakistani government, provoking anger in the militants’ ranks.

headline.seo: Pakistani Taliban Face a Leadership Rift
headline.main: Leadership Rift Emerges in Pakistani Taliban
headline.print_headline: Leadership Rift Emerges in Pakistani Taliban
